item.title: Street light out, 6th October
item.description:
The main street light in front of malorees infant school and the zebra crossing is not working. I didn't check if the poll had a number before I left. It felt unsafe collecting my child outside school at 7.15 with no street light

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enfield council discrimination, 6th October
item.description:
Yet again Enfield council are targeting Winchmore Hill for ghettoisation. The money spent on Winchmore hill is nil whilst Palmers Green, Edmonton and Southgate have street cleaning, bin emptying and grandiose schemes such as Devonshire square, costing hundreds of thousands. Winchmore Hill is filthy and in a state of misrepair and despair. The previous council leader was heard saying of Winchmore Hill , let them see how the other half live. Our bins are not emptied, even after a weekend, outside a major park that is Grovelands on church hill and fly tipping is encouraged through the promotion of unlicensed multi occupancies full of lone males. The hoppers road bin attached is not emptied and always surrounded by filthy fly tips uncollected. T Regular dumpers are not investigated or prosecuted. The woman on hoppers road dumps thirty plus nappies each day without reproach. We are on a downward trajectory. I am targeted and hoppers road has not been cleaned for weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downes Court, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: High street Harrow Road, 6th October
item.description:
Over flown bins taking up the pavement. Loads of household goods like mattresses. Nappies and soiled things all over the floor. It is disgraceful that the streets are left like this! It smells and itâ€™s disgusting This has been like this since last week and every time I drive past this road I see it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 6th October
item.description:
There are plastic bottles, paper, fast food packaging and cans on street alongside both sides of the road especially Beckett house and King's college student accommodation on Tabard street. As of today, the litter has not been removed despite fixmystreet saying it has been cleared up.
